positive.review:
Комиксная автобатлерная карточная арена. 
Звучит сложно, но по факту - простая и незатейливая.
Не могу сказать, что я фанат такого жанра, но кому-то зайдет.
I win more using random builds than anything else, so idk if that says more about the game or myself.

Quicker version of TFT, probably more fun. Takes a while to learn but incredibly addictive. A lot of people say its a pay to win game but you don't get any meaningful edge from spending money in my opinion. Its FTP anyway so if you're reading this review just play it instead!

Seeing lots of reviews about "Pay 2 Win" or "too much luck involved", I don't understand the pay to win aspect considering the heros you can get are incredibly strong and i almost never find a person playing a hero i couldnt play, the luck aspect is beyond me bc the game is beyond similar to games like Teamfight Tactics where its literally not luck its just purely decision making. I think the people making bad reviews are the ones who aren't very good and cant play the game well, and i get it this game IS hard autobattlers require a lot of strategy, and figuring out money making methods and what to buy when to buy it and what to buy to counter the enemies. But if you enjoy TFT or autobattlers, this game is the most fun I've had in a very long time.

Fun game if you like to gamble without money on the line. Early game trying out characters and learning and finding new combinations of builds, relics, synergies is fun, but quickly grows frustating as luck can force your defeats as it can give you free wins. Balance of the game is bad to extent that basic strategy include to know which characters to never pick. Difference in effectiveness of similar relics between worst and best can be over 100% on averange. Sometimes you lose just because you're unlucky and that's it, if you don't mind that, maybe you'll have fun.
 Not for me anymore, but I enjoyed the game until I got too frustated with it.

Not rly pay 2 win, the free to play experience is actually pretty friendly.
Gameplay is pretty fun and deep enough to create a fairly replayable game.
As a fan of autobattlers, this one is my favorite PvP one atm

"pay2win" BS
"random DC" Had not ONE ....
Why people whine on these I dont know...
You can just fine reach top league without spending a single dime.
Be active and get amoung the top people fairly easly.
You may find now and then you wish to have more gems or reroll tickets..... Just play out the season, and you get enough on both of them to unlock a hero or two, unlock new stuff maybe too, and have enough tickets to reroll a lot lol
Be active get for most part what you want, play just a few cry p2w or w/e.. up to you

CBA reading troll comments so no comment allow :D (how many will make a fist rofl)
to the negative reviews saying p2w. gitgud. yeah bit of rng, almost everything can be grinded. i think. pretty good game. fun
decent game,

From reading through the reviews of this game it appears that the main complaint is that it is pay-to-win, having never spent any money on this game personally and managing to achieve a high rank each season this seems completely false to me.

It's true that there are unlockables with currency that you can buy or earn in game through playing but the free-to-play model is generous enough that I have managed to unlock all the characters and treasures I wanted simply by playing.

In my opinion the reason so many people say its overly pay-to-win is a case of people not being able to identify the mistakes they are making in order to improve how they play so they choose to blame it on factors that are out of their control. This is a very typical attitude among gamers today.

Комиксная автобатлерная карточная арена. 
Звучит сложно, но по факту - простая и незатейливая.
Не могу сказать, что я фанат такого жанра, но кому-то зайдет.
its says ive played for 19 hours, but it feels like its closer to 4 or 5... great game guys, thanks a ton

Dont listen to the negative crybaby reviews. Its a autobattler with augments, reminds me of TFT in league of legends wich also involves a lot of RNG with the augments and units in the shop. This one is just a 1v1 autobattler where you have a lot of ways building your character, you have interest as well, so if you keep your money early game without spending you will get more like in TFT.

Its a fun game and even has a ranked system, i like it, its a nice change to playing TFT only. So far I enjoy it, and would say give it a try, if you are bad at games like this, just leave it and find a different game, i mean its a free game after all.

"Skill Legends Royale is like if chess, card games, and RPGs had a baby and then let it run wild in a fantasy playground. You pick a hero, draft skills like you're assembling a superhero team, and then watch as your choices either lead to glorious victory or hilarious failure. It's like cooking—sometimes you follow the recipe, sometimes you throw in a bit of everything and hope it tastes good.

The game's got that perfect balance of strategy and chaos. One minute you're stacking buffs like a pro, the next you're getting obliterated by a random combo you didn't see coming. It's unpredictable, it's fun, and it's a great reminder that sometimes, the journey is more entertaining than the destination.

Plus, it's free-to-play, so you can dive in without breaking the bank. Whether you're a strategy mastermind or just looking for a good time, Skill Legends Royale has got you covered.

10/10. Would draft skills, build heroes, and laugh at my own missteps again.
I win more using random builds than anything else, so idk if that says more about the game or myself.

Quicker version of TFT, probably more fun. Takes a while to learn but incredibly addictive. A lot of people say its a pay to win game but you don't get any meaningful edge from spending money in my opinion. Its FTP anyway so if you're reading this review just play it instead!

Seeing lots of reviews about "Pay 2 Win" or "too much luck involved", I don't understand the pay to win aspect considering the heros you can get are incredibly strong and i almost never find a person playing a hero i couldnt play, the luck aspect is beyond me bc the game is beyond similar to games like Teamfight Tactics where its literally not luck its just purely decision making. I think the people making bad reviews are the ones who aren't very good and cant play the game well, and i get it this game IS hard autobattlers require a lot of strategy, and figuring out money making methods and what to buy when to buy it and what to buy to counter the enemies. But if you enjoy TFT or autobattlers, this game is the most fun I've had in a very long time.

Fun game if you like to gamble without money on the line. Early game trying out characters and learning and finding new combinations of builds, relics, synergies is fun, but quickly grows frustating as luck can force your defeats as it can give you free wins. Balance of the game is bad to extent that basic strategy include to know which characters to never pick. Difference in effectiveness of similar relics between worst and best can be over 100% on averange. Sometimes you lose just because you're unlucky and that's it, if you don't mind that, maybe you'll have fun.
 Not for me anymore, but I enjoyed the game until I got too frustated with it.

Not rly pay 2 win, the free to play experience is actually pretty friendly.
Gameplay is pretty fun and deep enough to create a fairly replayable game.
As a fan of autobattlers, this one is my favorite PvP one atm

A surprisingly engaging and challenging action arena. The skill-based combat feels rewarding, and the matches are quick and fun. Great for a short burst of competitive play. Definitely worth checking out for fans of the genre.

Good game, whoever complains about RNG or unfairness, dude just get good and some critical thinking, if you know everybody is pushing the same branch then play something else, yes there is RNG but thats what makes the game fun, if you would play the same character with the same skills all the time, you would then complain about the game being boring

good game
simple design
fun competitive gameplay without P2W bs

even funnier with friends

"pay2win" BS
"random DC" Had not ONE ....
Why people whine on these I dont know...
You can just fine reach top league without spending a single dime.
Be active and get amoung the top people fairly easly.
You may find now and then you wish to have more gems or reroll tickets..... Just play out the season, and you get enough on both of them to unlock a hero or two, unlock new stuff maybe too, and have enough tickets to reroll a lot lol
Be active get for most part what you want, play just a few cry p2w or w/e.. up to you

CBA reading troll comments so no comment allow :D (how many will make a fist rofl)
to the negative reviews saying p2w. gitgud. yeah bit of rng, almost everything can be grinded. i think. pretty good game. fun
very fun f2p pvp roguelike game that never get you tilted to play
This is exactly the game that I was missing
unskill random royale
like auto chess but fun
decent game,
good game
Good game.
fun
me likey
why not

negative.review:
RED FLAG
well they now want to collect your data and you need to accept that.
most concerning thigs imo are:
"and your online behavior" 
but also
"and/or other information we deem necessary" and "and storage information"
and
"We may engage other companies or individuals to provide services on our behalf"

copy paste (this is just a part of it and not everything):
I. Collection and Use of Information
1. Game Data

Whenever you use our Services, we collect data about your interactions with our Services and other users. The information we collect may include player ID, your game progress, IP address, device ID, and/or other information we deem necessary to enhance your user experience and maintain the quality of our Services.
2. User Device

We may need your device or related information to provide troubleshooting solutions and understand customer usage trends. The information we collect includes unique device ID, operating system, device model, device language, screen resolution, network type, battery level, and storage information.

The data listed above may be used to track content you access through our Services and your online behavior, or to improve the security and stability of our Services.

Terribly unbalanced, skip it.

As a fan of auto-battlers, I have played this game a ton. Sadly I can't recommend it. There is way too many things that are terribly balanced ( a- matchmaking, both in terms of lobby and round-to-round matchmaking, b - skill branches, because some skill branches are terrible in almost every lobby while others are always strong (haste and freeze to give an example), c- treasures in terms of power scaling, just to name a few of the horrible balancing issues) as a result of these, the game more frustrating than enjoyable to play. Don't waste time on this one.

Skill Legends Royale has a lot of potential, but right now it’s held back by how difficult it is to learn from your losses. When a match ends, you only get about 0–2 seconds to review what actually happened. On mobile, it’s even worse, your placement screen immediately covers the entire UI, and there’s no way to clear it before the fight information disappears.

For a competitive game, this makes the learning curve frustrating. The combat log offers almost no detail beyond basic damage numbers, and there’s no way to review the actual sequence of events from the fight. A more accessible, persistent combat log or replay-style breakdown would go a long way in helping players improve.

The game also really needs a match history and the ability to view complete builds after a match ends, similar to what most other competitive titles provide. Without these tools, it’s hard to understand how a fight played out or what decisions led to the outcome.

Balance is another concern. New heroes often launch overtuned, and adjustments tend to happen slowly

------------------------

Update : I have a free account where i have no tarots and i have a main account with 2500 tarots won from playing in tournament.

On my free account, the game feels challenging and i have to play with limited tools, my main account feels like an entirely different game. I can just choose whatever i want or whatever I need most of the time. It honestly feels like an entirely different game / experience.

The RNG with crit and dodge is awful. Sometimes, even when crit isnt in the lobby, youll be crit by things for your entire life bar just because of some dumb 15% chance to crit that the enemy has by default. 
These crits decide entire lobbies. For example, i was fighting someone with 5k health and they where stunned but they got a single ult off during a tiny stun gap and they one shot me with a crit ultimate. (Crit damage is honestly too high imo, its like 250% dmg by default)

I said it before and ill say it again, this game feels like a slot machine where sometimes you win and youre feeling high and other times you lose and it feels lame and out of your control.

There is skill to this game and ways to express that but its not always the case. You will get screwed over by dumb RNG and that's the way it is. Crit branch and dodge branch are just lame af.

------------------------------

Also, why doesn't the game tell you who you're fighting next when it is already known and the info is available in the combat history. Whoever you fight on turn 1, you will fight 7 turns later. So 1-8, 2-9. 3-10, 4-11 etc.  You have to go through this awful combat log to find out who's next for no reason.

__________________

On the NA server, and im sure on others, the lobbies are always filled with bots. On NA is like 60% bots in every lobby which makes the game feel so boring. Id rather wait twice or three times as long of a que to get a lobby filled with players. But the dev's do weird things to make it seem like its not a bot, like coming up with AI generated names for the bots that are usually different but tend to be dumb generic names or some symbols. If you surrender the game, a bot just takes your place and plays for you. So if youre in a 1v1 vs someone and the game is going to go for 5 more rounds until its over, even if you surrender, the other player is just stuck in a lobby killing your bot for the next 5 minutes. The game doesnt end when you surrender like every other auto battle game. 

the excess of bots and the hiding of bots is trrrrrrrrrrrrash. They should just merge the servers together because latency doesnt matter too much in this game (although it can have some impact if you experience lag during a big roll down, lets say you have 3k+ gold youre trying to spend in a turn). Having one server would allow for a casual que and an actual ranked que with bans which would make the game alot better since the new heroes they add are extremely overpowered

Guys, listen. Don't play this game. This game can be fun, but it's super unbalanced. Devs keep unbalanced strategies alive so you would suffer if rng is not on your side. Without a premium you won't progress at all unless you play all the time.

Don't waste your TIME!!!!
Used to be good. deep learning curve but fair. Now its nothing but people cheating... it seems all games like this always devolves into rng smoothing cheat programs

Extremely luck based. Not just the fact that the gameplay is based on luck (which is completely fine).

What bothers me is that theres no easy way to learn. No way to look at what your enemy had after a battle, no way to see what your cards did after you died. No Information to improve apon. If they fix that it would be a good game. Else its a bit of bumbling about
extremely pay to win with a completely unmoderated chat full of the most awful garbage possible

well they now want to collect your data and you need to accept that.
most concerning thigs imo are:
"and your online behavior" 
but also
"and/or other information we deem necessary" and "and storage information"
and
"We may engage other companies or individuals to provide services on our behalf"

copy paste (this is just a part of it and not everything):
I. Collection and Use of Information
1. Game Data

Whenever you use our Services, we collect data about your interactions with our Services and other users. The information we collect may include player ID, your game progress, IP address, device ID, and/or other information we deem necessary to enhance your user experience and maintain the quality of our Services.
2. User Device

We may need your device or related information to provide troubleshooting solutions and understand customer usage trends. The information we collect includes unique device ID, operating system, device model, device language, screen resolution, network type, battery level, and storage information.

The data listed above may be used to track content you access through our Services and your online behavior, or to improve the security and stability of our Services.
Devs are always saying that RNG is an important feature in the game but it is obvious that you can fix it by paying money to roll some more. What a clown.

This game can be fun but for like first few days and first few levels. Then you start to be aware it is purely pay to win, which is understandable as they want to make profit out of it, and it is more dedicated on selling winning than selling skins, additional heroes, content etc. There is almost no skill required to play this game it is like 80% random roll, you just need to know for what skills to roll. And you get more chances on random rolls when you pay. You got more chances on rolling heros, more heroes to choose from, more chances on rolling treasures. Which basically decides on your chances of winning. It is still possible to get some heroes and additional rolls with playing the game. But you would spend whole days doing so. I managed to be 3 times overking level, but still I would recommend other game if you like to invest your time and not money on winnign. For casual plays like 1-2 times per day it can be fun.

Game is entirely pay to win. Sure you CAN win without the privledge from the pass, but your win rate will be so much lower and it will be so much less fun. Its a fun game but not worth a monthly subscription price to just be able to play on even grounds.

Terribly unbalanced, skip it.

As a fan of auto-battlers, I have played this game a ton. Sadly I can't recommend it. There is way too many things that are terribly balanced ( a- matchmaking, both in terms of lobby and round-to-round matchmaking, b - skill branches, because some skill branches are terrible in almost every lobby while others are always strong (haste and freeze to give an example), c- treasures in terms of power scaling, just to name a few of the horrible balancing issues) as a result of these, the game more frustrating than enjoyable to play. Don't waste time on this one.

Skill Legends Royale has a lot of potential, but right now it’s held back by how difficult it is to learn from your losses. When a match ends, you only get about 0–2 seconds to review what actually happened. On mobile, it’s even worse, your placement screen immediately covers the entire UI, and there’s no way to clear it before the fight information disappears.

For a competitive game, this makes the learning curve frustrating. The combat log offers almost no detail beyond basic damage numbers, and there’s no way to review the actual sequence of events from the fight. A more accessible, persistent combat log or replay-style breakdown would go a long way in helping players improve.

The game also really needs a match history and the ability to view complete builds after a match ends, similar to what most other competitive titles provide. Without these tools, it’s hard to understand how a fight played out or what decisions led to the outcome.

Balance is another concern. New heroes often launch overtuned, and adjustments tend to happen slowly

------------------------

I. Collection and Use of Information
1. Game Data

Whenever you use our Services, we collect data about your interactions with our Services and other users. The information we collect may include player ID, your game progress, IP address, device ID, and/or other information we deem necessary to enhance your user experience and maintain the quality of our Services.
2. User Device

We may need your device or related information to provide troubleshooting solutions and understand customer usage trends. The information we collect includes unique device ID, operating system, device model, device language, screen resolution, network type, battery level, and storage information.

The data listed above may be used to track content you access through our Services and your online behavior, or to improve the security and stability of our Services.
Devs are always saying that RNG is an important feature in the game but it is obvious that you can fix it by paying money to roll some more. What a clown.

This game can be fun but for like first few days and first few levels. Then you start to be aware it is purely pay to win, which is understandable as they want to make profit out of it, and it is more dedicated on selling winning than selling skins, additional heroes, content etc. There is almost no skill required to play this game it is like 80% random roll, you just need to know for what skills to roll. And you get more chances on random rolls when you pay. You got more chances on rolling heros, more heroes to choose from, more chances on rolling treasures. Which basically decides on your chances of winning. It is still possible to get some heroes and additional rolls with playing the game. But you would spend whole days doing so. I managed to be 3 times overking level, but still I would recommend other game if you like to invest your time and not money on winnign. For casual plays like 1-2 times per day it can be fun.

Game is entirely pay to win. Sure you CAN win without the privledge from the pass, but your win rate will be so much lower and it will be so much less fun. Its a fun game but not worth a monthly subscription price to just be able to play on even grounds.

Terribly unbalanced, skip it.

As a fan of auto-battlers, I have played this game a ton. Sadly I can't recommend it. There is way too many things that are terribly balanced ( a- matchmaking, both in terms of lobby and round-to-round matchmaking, b - skill branches, because some skill branches are terrible in almost every lobby while others are always strong (haste and freeze to give an example), c- treasures in terms of power scaling, just to name a few of the horrible balancing issues) as a result of these, the game more frustrating than enjoyable to play. Don't waste time on this one.

Skill Legends Royale has a lot of potential, but right now it’s held back by how difficult it is to learn from your losses. When a match ends, you only get about 0–2 seconds to review what actually happened. On mobile, it’s even worse, your placement screen immediately covers the entire UI, and there’s no way to clear it before the fight information disappears.

For a competitive game, this makes the learning curve frustrating. The combat log offers almost no detail beyond basic damage numbers, and there’s no way to review the actual sequence of events from the fight. A more accessible, persistent combat log or replay-style breakdown would go a long way in helping players improve.

The game also really needs a match history and the ability to view complete builds after a match ends, similar to what most other competitive titles provide. Without these tools, it’s hard to understand how a fight played out or what decisions led to the outcome.

Balance is another concern. New heroes often launch overtuned, and adjustments tend to happen slowly

------------------------

Update : I have a free account where i have no tarots and i have a main account with 2500 tarots won from playing in tournament.

On my free account, the game feels challenging and i have to play with limited tools, my main account feels like an entirely different game. I can just choose whatever i want or whatever I need most of the time. It honestly feels like an entirely different game / experience.

The RNG with crit and dodge is awful. Sometimes, even when crit isnt in the lobby, youll be crit by things for your entire life bar just because of some dumb 15% chance to crit that the enemy has by default. 
These crits decide entire lobbies. For example, i was fighting someone with 5k health and they where stunned but they got a single ult off during a tiny stun gap and they one shot me with a crit ultimate. (Crit damage is honestly too high imo, its like 250% dmg by default)

I said it before and ill say it again, this game feels like a slot machine where sometimes you win and youre feeling high and other times you lose and it feels lame and out of your control.

There is skill to this game and ways to express that but its not always the case. You will get screwed over by dumb RNG and that's the way it is. Crit branch and dodge branch are just lame af.

------------------------------

Also, why doesn't the game tell you who you're fighting next when it is already known and the info is available in the combat history. Whoever you fight on turn 1, you will fight 7 turns later. So 1-8, 2-9. 3-10, 4-11 etc.  You have to go through this awful combat log to find out who's next for no reason.

On the NA server, and im sure on others, the lobbies are always filled with bots. On NA is like 60% bots in every lobby which makes the game feel so boring. Id rather wait twice or three times as long of a que to get a lobby filled with players. But the dev's do weird things to make it seem like its not a bot, like coming up with AI generated names for the bots that are usually different but tend to be dumb generic names or some symbols. If you surrender the game, a bot just takes your place and plays for you. So if youre in a 1v1 vs someone and the game is going to go for 5 more rounds until its over, even if you surrender, the other player is just stuck in a lobby killing your bot for the next 5 minutes. The game doesnt end when you surrender like every other auto battle game. 

the excess of bots and the hiding of bots is trrrrrrrrrrrrash. They should just merge the servers together because latency doesnt matter too much in this game (although it can have some impact if you experience lag during a big roll down, lets say you have 3k+ gold youre trying to spend in a turn). Having one server would allow for a casual que and an actual ranked que with bans with would make the game alot better since the new heroes they add are extremely overpowered
